img.title: Coronavirus

span.span:
SCHOOLS WILL BE CLOSED UNTIL MAY 15TH AT THE ORDER OF NEW YORK STATE GOVERNOR ANDREW CUOMO.
STAY HOME. STOP THE SPREAD. SAVE LIVES.

span.style: font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

span.span: There are two testing sites for Coronavirus in our area. One is at

a.title: Map and Directions to Testing Site
a.style: color: rgb(18, 91, 159); font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center;

span.a: SUNY Stony Brook University in South P Lot

span.style: font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

a.title: Coram COVID-19 Testing Site
a.style: color: rgb(18, 91, 159); font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center;

span.a: Elsie Owens Health Center in Coram

span.style: font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

span.span: . Only those experiencing symptoms of Coronavirus will be tested.

br.style: color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center;
color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center;

span.style: font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

br.span: There is also rapid COVID-19 testing available at three locations on Long Island.

a.title: Rapid Coronavirus Testing
a.style: color: rgb(18, 91, 159); font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center;

br.a: Learn more by reading this article

span.style: font-size: large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

img.p: To complete the Comsewogue Family Check-In form, please go to this link.

p.span: As we all adapt to this new COVID 19 reality, please know that Response Crisis Center is here to offer emotional support and crisis counseling through our hotline and online services.
There are a number of ways you can connect with a counselor:
Our 24/7 local hotline-631-751-7500
The 24/7 National Suicide Prevention Lifeline-we are the area provider-1-800-273-TALK
Our online chat is available 7 days/week 7pm-3:30AM through the Lifeline Crisis Chat

We highly recommend registering your cell phone for Smart911. With Smart911, you can provide 9-1-1 call takers and first responders critical information you want them to know in any kind of emergency. When you dial 9-1-1 from a mobile phone, the 9-1-1 call takers have very little information to help you. Visit the Smart911 website today.
SCOPE is offering emergency child care. Please visit this website for more details. Additionally, you may call them at 631-360-0800.

p.span: To listen to Dr. Quinn's phone calls / updates, please visit this page of our website. You can also read transcripts of the phone calls. Additionally, view Dr. Quinn's letter t the community from March 27
in
or

To view a list of Nationwide Food Delivery Programs, please go to this link. Food distribution is occurring every Tuesday and Thursday from 11:30 AM to 12:30 PM at JFK Middle School.
There is also a list available of food pantries that are open in our area.

All elementary school students are currently working on assignments in packets that were sent home. Links to the packets can be found here. Students in grades 6-12 are accessing coursework through Google Classroom. We have also created a Distance Learning Resources page for parents.
If you need to contact your teacher, we have provided a teacher directory on this page.

Annual Reviews, CPSE, CSE and 504 meetings that were scheduled for the next two weeks have been postponed. Some of these sessions are being held via phone conference, as outlined in this letter. If you have questions regarding your Annual Review, please email Rob Pearl, District Administrator for Pupil Personnel Services.
As per New York State, the following tests scheduled to be administered in the 2019-2020 school year have been suspended:
NYS Grades 3-8 English Language Arts & Math Exams
NYS Grades 4 & 8 Science Exams
NYS Grades K-12 NYSESLAT (English as a Second Language Achievement) Test
NYS Grades 3-12 Alternate Assessment for students with severe cognitive disabilities
NYS June 2020 Regents Examinations (please see this page for full details regarding the Regents exams)
We have created a list of community resources that you may be interested in during this difficult time. You can view the list of resources here.
Section XI has cancelled all practices, games and contests until April 29th.
